intro: Hieracium pseudocaudatulum, commonly known as the false cat's ear, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has a rosette of basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium pseudocaudatulum is native to Europe and has been introduced to other parts of the world, where it can sometimes become invasive.
